How to Install xbrlapi on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • xbrlapi

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install xbrlapi on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing xbrlapi on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall xbrlapi in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install xbrlapi, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install xbrlapi Using apt

To install xbrlapi in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install xbrlapi using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install xbrlapi

The installation of xbrlapi might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install xbrlapi Using apt-get

To install xbrlapi using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install xbrlapi.

sudo apt-get -y install xbrlapi

Install xbrlapi Using Synaptic

To install xbrlapi using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install xbrlapi on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for xbrlapi. This will display the xbrlapi package in the package window, now to install xbrlapi, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the xbrlapi package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of xbrlapi.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install xbrlapi Using aptitude

To install xbrlapi on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of xbrlapi.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install xbrlapi using the command aptitude install xbrlapi.

sudo aptitude -y install xbrlapi

How to Upgrade xbrlapi on debian

If you want to upgrade the xbrlapi package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade xbrlapi using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade xbrlapi to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade xbrlapi.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade xbrlapi sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade xbrlapi

Upgrade xbrlapi using Aptitude

To upgrade xbrlapi using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade xbrlapi.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade xbrlapi

Upgrade xbrlapi using Synaptic

To upgrade xbrlapi using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for xbrlapi, now right-click xbrlapi, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade xbrlapi just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall xbrlapi on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall xbrlapi from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just xbrlapi, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove xbrlapi

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of xbrlapi

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of xbrlapi you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge xbrlapi

Remove xbrlapi using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall xbrlapi using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for xbrlapi, right-click the xbrlapi package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall xbrlapi click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install xbrlapi on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade xbrlapi using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of xbrlapi then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
